result.execSummary:
The defendant Joe T. Atkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joe T. Atkinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joe T. Atkinson was found guilty of Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ offense, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COUNTS 1&3 DISMISSED.

9:10  Defendant Joe T. Atkinson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pled No Contest to Ct. 2; Court adjudged defendant guilty and ordered JOC; Court dismissed Counts 1 and 3.  Sentence:  Five months in Columbia County Jail with huber, beginning May 8, 2015 @ 7:00pm, consecutive to any other sentence; $518 fine/costs, payable in 60 days or payment plan; DNA sample; defendant may apply for electronic monitoring.  Jail credit of 5 days, if more, stipulation will be submitted.  9:25
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on March 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joe T. Atkinson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Bond remains.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Joe T. Atkinson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martinez requesting Prelim, bond cont'd  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Joe T. Atkinson, appeared pro se. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court noted Atty. Statement by defendant, has no objection to bond amendment. Bond amended to include no contact with R.D., his immediate family, his workplace or residence. Order signed.
